BytC28DfH.description: The value to watch for changes
BytC28DfH.label: DATA

H1fx68wzB.description: Fires a pulse on an incoming value change, on boot, on activation but only if `ACT` is set to `True`

@/act.description: Pulses when `ACT` is `True` and one of the following happens: the data on `DATA` pin changes, program boot, `ACT` has changed from `False` to `True`. Use this node to convert a boolean value which denotes activity/enableness to discrete update action pulses which appear right at the moments when you should reflect the changes in incoming data.

@/and.description: Outputs true if and only if all inputs are true

Bk--RE_rV.description: The current value of number animation.

BkE3a4uHV.description: The final value of `OUT` in the animation.
BkE3a4uHV.label: TO

H1010NuBE.description: Quickly rewind `OUT` to `FROM` and stop the animation
H1010NuBE.label: REV

HJIa6E_r4.description: Defines the animation speed: amount of `OUT` change per second
HJIa6E_r4.label: RATE

S1Rp6EuBE.description: Set `OUT` to `FROM` and start animation. If the animation is in progress already it is cancelled, the new one is started.
S1Rp6EuBE.label: PLAY

r1AsTEuHE.description: The starting value of `OUT` in the animation.
r1AsTEuHE.label: FROM

rJIn0NdBV.description: Quickly forward `OUT` to `TO` and stop the animation.
rJIn0NdBV.label: FWD

rkyv-a5S4.description: Pulses when the animation completes, that is the `OUT` value reaches the end. The pulse is not emitted when the animation is stopped with `REV` or `FWD`.
rkyv-a5S4.label: DONE

ry6X04drV.description: Active. Outputs whether the animation is in progress.
ry6X04drV.label: ACT

@/animation-segment.description: Animates a number making it run from one boundary to another with the given rate.

BkbYcVSuHE.description: Quickly rewind `OUT` to 0.0 and stop the animation
BkbYcVSuHE.label: REV

ByGYcNBdS4.description: Quickly forward `OUT` to 1.0 and stop the animation.
ByGYcNBdS4.label: FWD

H1e_sEruBN.description: Active. Outputs whether the animation is in progress.
H1e_sEruBN.label: ACT

HJ_oNS_HE.description: The current value of number animation. Always in range [0, 1].

SkYq4r_B4.description: Defines the animation speed: amount of `OUT` change per second
SkYq4r_B4.label: RATE

SylFqNr_S4.description: Set `OUT` to 0.0 and start animation. If the animation is in progress already it is cancelled, the new one is started.
SylFqNr_S4.label: PLAY

rJJhl6cH4.description: Pulses when the animation completes, that is the `OUT` value reaches 1.0. The pulse is not emitted when the animation is stopped with `REV` or `FWD`.
rJJhl6cH4.label: DONE

@/animation-unit.description: Animates a number making it run from 0.0 to 1.0

@/any.description: Pulses on output when any input recieves a pulse

S1OlUAuBD1-.description: Value which defines the route for an input pulse
S1OlUAuBD1-.label: GATE

@/branch.description: Routes an incoming pulse to either of outputs depending on condition

@/boot.description: Outputs a single pulse when the program starts

attachments.content:
BOOT
pulse
no-pulse
no-pulse

@/cast-to-pulse(boolean).description: Emits a pulse on a rising edge, i.e. when false changes to true. Does not pulse on program start even if initial input value is true.

@/cast-to-boolean(number).description: Transforms 0.0 to false and any other value to true

@/cast-to-string(boolean).description: Transforms boolean false to string “false” and true to “true”

@/cast-to-number(boolean).description: Transforms true value to 1.0 and false to 0.0

@/cast-to-string(number).description: Transforms a number to string with two digits after dot

BJJICN2lW.description: Resets current count, restarts clock with new interval
BJJICN2lW.label: RST

HJU8CE2lW.description: Pulses on each time interval end
HJU8CE2lW.label: TICK

r1jzp_DTZ.description: Is the clock enabled, i.e. produces ticks? At the moment when set to true, starts counting from scratch.
r1jzp_DTZ.label: EN

attachments.content:
__time(ms)	IVAL	EN	RST	TICK
0	0.1	true	no-pulse	no-pulse
100	0.1	true	pulse	no-pulse
120	0.1	true	no-pulse	no-pulse
201	0.1	true	no-pulse	pulse
250	0.1	true	no-pulse	no-pulse
302	0.1	true	no-pulse	pulse
350	0.1	false	no-pulse	no-pulse
403	0.1	false	no-pulse	no-pulse
0	1	true	pulse	no-pulse
500	1	true	pulse	no-pulse
1001	1	true	no-pulse	no-pulse
1501	1	true	no-pulse	pulse
// edge case: when IVAL is 0, `clock` should constantly emit pulses
0	0	true	no-pulse	pulse
1	0	true	no-pulse	pulse
2	1	true	no-pulse	pulse
1003	1	true	no-pulse	pulse
// edge case: when IVAL is negative, behave like it's 0
0	-1	true	no-pulse	pulse
1	-1	true	no-pulse	pulse
2	1	true	no-pulse	pulse
1003	1	true	no-pulse	pulse

@/console-log.description: Outputs a line of text to the board standard debug interface

@/constant-boolean.description: A predefined `true` or `false` value that never changes in runtime

@/constant-number.description: A predefined numeric value that never changes in runtime

@/constant-byte.description: A predefined single byte datum that never changes in runtime

attachments.content:
TICK
pulse
pulse
pulse
pulse

@/constant-string.description: A predefined text string that never changes in runtime. Non-ASCII characters are encoded in UTF-8.

SkJ46dw6-.description: Determines if pulses should be continuously emitted
SkJ46dw6-.label: EN

@/continuously-pausable.description: Continuously outputs pulses, can be paused

attachments.content:
EN	TICK
true	pulse
true	pulse
true	pulse
false	no-pulse
false	no-pulse
false	no-pulse
true	pulse
true	pulse

HJvqZ0dLZ.description: Value to add on each increment. Use a negative value (e.g. -1) to make decrements.
HJvqZ0dLZ.label: STEP

SkUjZA_L-.description: Resets the accumulated value to zero.
SkUjZA_L-.label: RST

@/count.description: Stores a number which gets incremented on each `INC` pulse.

@/debounce.description: Debounces a value. The `OUT` value would change only after a period of at least `Ts` seconds while which the input state `ST` has not changed.

@/debounce(boolean).description: Debounces a boolean value. The `OUT` value would change only after a period of at least `Ts` seconds while which the input state `ST` has not changed. The node is useful to fight signal bouncing of mechanical switches.

@/defer(boolean).description: Allows to create feedback loops. Repeats a change of the input on the output right after the current transaction will complete.

@/debounce(number).description: Debounces a number value. The `OUT` value would change only after a period of at least `Ts` seconds while which the input state `ST` has not changed.

@/defer(byte).description: Allows to create feedback loops. Repeats a change of the input on the output right after the current transaction will complete.

@/defer.description: Allows to create feedback loops. Repeats a change of the input on the output right after the current transaction will complete.

@/defer(number).description: Allows to create feedback loops. Repeats a change of the input on the output right after the current transaction will complete.

@/defer(string).description: Allows to create feedback loops. Repeats a change of the input on the output right after the current transaction will complete.

@/defer(pulse).description: Allows to create feedback loops. Repeats a change of the input on the output right after the current transaction will complete.

S1bhCQqVM.description: Update: trigger a calculation and store the current `IN` value as the new “past” value.
S1bhCQqVM.label: UPD

SyYn0X5NM.description: Resets the stored past value to the current input value. Efficiently sets `OUT` to 0.
SyYn0X5NM.label: RST

@/delta.description: Calculates difference between current and past input values.

attachments.content:
IN	UPD	RST	OUT
0	no-pulse	no-pulse	0
10	pulse	no-pulse	10
30	no-pulse	no-pulse	10
20	no-pulse	pulse	0
30	pulse	no-pulse	10
50	pulse	no-pulse	20
10	pulse	no-pulse	-40
10	pulse	pulse	0
5	pulse	no-pulse	-5

Bk4gU0drwJ-.description: Pulses once the delay is over
Bk4gU0drwJ-.label: DONE

H1mlUC_HDJZ.description: Resets current countdown, i.e. cancels the delay
H1mlUC_HDJZ.label: RST

HkU3vNoTW.description: Outputs true when delay is in progress
HkU3vNoTW.label: ACT

SkSuD6LMb.description: Resets current countdown, starts new countdown
SkSuD6LMb.label: SET

@/delay.description: Delays triggering of an incoming pulse by specified time

attachments.content:
__time(ms)	T	SET	RST	DONE	ACT
0	0.5	no-pulse	no-pulse	no-pulse	false
1000	0.5	pulse	no-pulse	no-pulse	true
1500	0.5	no-pulse	no-pulse	no-pulse	true
1501	0.5	no-pulse	no-pulse	pulse	false
2000	0.5	pulse	pulse	no-pulse	false
2500	0.5	pulse	no-pulse	no-pulse	true
2600	2	no-pulse	no-pulse	no-pulse	true
2700	2	no-pulse	pulse	no-pulse	false
3001	2	no-pulse	no-pulse	no-pulse	false

B1OK07cVz.description: Time difference in seconds between the current and previous updates. Always equals to 0 on the first update.

@/delta-time.description: Outputs time difference between the current and previous updates.

BJuXiAK1z.description: Duty cycle of ON time in range [0, 1]
BJuXiAK1z.label: DUTY

@/duty-to-time.description: Converts total time and duty cycle values into absolute on/off time values

@/equal.description: Outputs true if `IN1` = `IN2`, and false otherwise

@/equal(boolean).description: Outputs true if `IN1` = `IN2`, and false otherwise

@/equal(byte).description: Outputs true if `IN1` = `IN2`, and false otherwise

@/equal(number).description: Outputs true if `IN1` = `IN2`, and false otherwise

@/equal(string).description: Outputs true if `IN1` = `IN2`, and false otherwise

H1JuNDn9E.description: The value passed through the node.

r13uED2cN.description: The node raises an error on the `True` value.
r13uED2cN.label: ERR

rkdPED3cE.description: A value to pass through the node.

@/error.description: Raises an error when the `ERR` input pin receives the `True` value. Otherwise, the node passes the value from the `IN` pin to the `OUT` pin.

H2JuNDn8C.description: The pulse passed through the node.

r13uED2cN.description: The node raises an error on the `True` value.
r13uED2cN.label: ERR

rkdP4D3bF.description: A pulse to pass through the node.

@/error(pulse).description: Raises an error when the `ERR` input pin receives the `True` value. Otherwise, it fires the pulse on the `OUT` pin when the `IN` pin receives a pulse.

BkweckF8-.description: Speed rate in units per second.
BkweckF8-.label: RATE

HJblc1YUZ.description: Triggers an update (i.e. recalculation) of `OUT` value. Keep the value set to `Continuously` to achieve the most smooth animation possible.
HJblc1YUZ.label: UPD

HyYJqJFLZ.description: The target value to strive for.
HyYJqJFLZ.label: TARG

@/fade.description: Lineary animates an internal value toward target value `TARG` with a rate `RATE`. Use the node to smoothen LED switching, motor starting, or servo angular position update.

0	1	1	pulse	0

1000	1	1	pulse	1
1500	1	1	pulse	1
1600	1	1	no-pulse	1
1999	0	0.1	no-pulse	1
2000	0	0.1	pulse	1~
2500	0	0.1	pulse	0.95~
3000	NaN	1	pulse	NaN
4000	1	NaN	pulse	1
5000	1	Inf	pulse	1
6000	-1	Inf	pulse	-1
7000	-100	-Inf	pulse	Inf
8000	Inf	-Inf	pulse	Inf

BkE-fCKJG.description: The signal value. Always `false` if the flip sequence is not active.
BkE-fCKJG.label: OUT

ByUpxAtJG.description: Cancels the flipping sequence if in progress.
ByUpxAtJG.label: RST

S1vneCK1z.description: Runs a new flip sequence. Cancels the existing if in progress.
S1vneCK1z.label: SET

SJ1e-CKkf.description: Time to be OFF per cycle. In seconds.
SJ1e-CKkf.label: Toff

r1Is6RFkG.description: The current number of cycle. Starts from 0.
r1Is6RFkG.label: Nc

r1v0xCYJf.description: Time to be ON per cycle. In seconds.
r1v0xCYJf.label: Ton

rknsx0tyf.description: Number of times the signal should pass the on-off cycle
rknsx0tyf.label: N

ByJRI0Kyf.content: Suspend the wave generator right after the last `true` without waiting for the cycle tail (`false`). Such way we avoid a short `true` triggering caused by the defer node at the end.

@/flip-n-times.description: Generates `N` switches of output boolean signal. Useful to flash/blink/flip/switch something for several times in a row.

attachments.content:
SET	TGL	RST	MEM
no-pulse	no-pulse	no-pulse	false
pulse	no-pulse	no-pulse	true
no-pulse	pulse	no-pulse	false
no-pulse	pulse	no-pulse	true
no-pulse	no-pulse	no-pulse	true
no-pulse	no-pulse	pulse	false
no-pulse	no-pulse	pulse	false
pulse	pulse	pulse	false
pulse	pulse	pulse	false
pulse	pulse	no-pulse	true
pulse	pulse	no-pulse	true
no-pulse	pulse	no-pulse	false

rysPErzmm.description: The resulting string. The starting value is “...”

@/format-progress.description: Outputs one of “...”, “OK”, “ERR” depending on the pulse which came last. Useful for demonstrating progress of a long-running process.

@/gate.description: Allows values to pass through only if EN pin is set to true

HJ_iDDln7.label: PUSH

S1LhPPl37.label: RST

attachments.content:

0	1	pulse	no-pulse	0

@/join.description: Joins multiple strings together inserting a delimiter between each pair. Useful for separating string parts with spaces and building CSV lines.

""	0

"I said: \"Hello, World!\""	23

@/if-error(pulse).description: Passes pulse from IN to OUT if it does not carry an error. Otherwise, pulses on error if the DEF pin received a pulse.

@/nand.description: Outputs false if and only if all inputs are true

@/nor.description: Outputs true if and only if all inputs are false

SJ-BNy8s2G.description: Index to select. All values below 1 are considered to be 0. Values of 1 and above are considered to be 1.

SyHEk8jhz.description: Utility output needed for expanding node. Shoud be ignored by the end user.

r1ctYrM3G.description: The selected value. Equals to one of `Xi` input.

@/nth-input.description: Selects either `X0` or `X1` based on `IDX` index value.

HyxBrZLM3f.description: Utility output needed for expanding node. Shoud be ignored by the end user.

SJHSSZ8f3f.description: Index to select. All values below 1 are considered to be 0. Values of 1 and above are considered to be 1.
SJHSSZ8f3f.label: IDX

r1g3WLf2G.description: The selected value. Equals to one of `Xi` input.

@/nth-input(string).description: Selects either `X0` or `X1` based on `IDX` index value.

@/less.description: Outputs true if `IN1` < `IN2`, and false otherwise

BJlMxW8M3f.description: Utility output needed for expanding node. Shoud be ignored by the end user.

H1rzg-Uf3M.description: The selected value. Equals to one of `Xi` input.

Hk8GeZIfnM.description: Index to select. All values below 1 are considered to be 0. Values of 1 and above are considered to be 1.
Hk8GeZIfnM.label: IDX

@/nth-input(number).description: Selects either `X0` or `X1` based on `IDX` index value.

By1A_gLfB.description: Outputs true when `EN` is true or it became false less than `T` seconds ago
By1A_gLfB.label: ACT

HkkyKlLGB.description: Resets the overrun timer causing `ACT` to switch to false immediately. The `DONE` pulse will not fire.
HkkyKlLGB.label: RST

Sk56ueUfS.description: Pulses once the overrun is over
Sk56ueUfS.label: DONE

@/overrun.description: Delays changes of the `EN` value from true to false by the specified time. Switching `EN` from false to true acts instantly.

@/pad-with-zeroes.description: Transforms a number into a string and adds zeroes to the beginning of the string until it is W-sized. Ignores a fractional part of the value and a sign. If the width of a string for a number is greater than the specified W value, node produces a string with the untransformed number

BycP9Q9NM.description: Computed effect value. Usually sent to an actuator like motor, cooler, etc.

ByeiM975VM.description: I (integral) factor. Set to 0 to disable. Non-zero value control a reaction to the accumulated error value.
ByeiM975VM.label: Ki

H1hf57qVG.description: D (derivative) factor. Set to 0 to disable. Non-zero value control a reaction to the rate of error change.
H1hf57qVG.label: Kd

HJVnt7c4f.description: Current actual value. Usually provided by a feedback mechanism such as encoder, thermometer, or another sensor.
HJVnt7c4f.label: IN

HkYH9QcEz.description: Resets computed errors and rates. Leads to starting computation from scratch.
HkYH9QcEz.label: RST

rJszc7qNG.description: P (proportional) factor. Set to 0 to disable, positive value to increase `OUT` if `IN` is less than `TARG`, negative value to inverse. Start with tweaking this coefficient first. Values in range (0.0, 2.0) usually give a decent result.
rJszc7qNG.label: Kp

rkY46Q5NG.description: Target, desired value. The final effect of `OUT` would make `IN` converge to `TARG` if coefficients set up correctly.
rkY46Q5NG.label: TARG

@/pid-controller.description: A proportional–integral–derivative controller. Computes fuzzy output value based on an actual current input value and the desired value.

@/or.description: Outputs false if and only if all inputs are false

true	pulse

true	pulse

The altimeter setting.
The standard pressure level of 1013.25 mbar

@/pressure-to-altitude.description: Converts pressure in pascals to altitude in meters, using 1976 US Standard Atmosphere model. This formula only applies to a height of 11 km, or about 36000 ft.

@/pulse-on-change.description: Emits a pulse every time input value changes.

@/pulse-on-error.description: Fires a pulse when the upstream node enters the error state.

@/pulse-on-false.description: Emits a pulse on a falling edge, i.e. when true changes to false. Does not pulse on program start even if initial input value is false.

attachments.content:
IN	OUT
false	no-pulse	// do not pulse even if initial state is false
true	no-pulse
false	pulse
true	no-pulse
false	pulse
false	no-pulse
true	no-pulse
false	pulse

@/pulse-on-true.description: Emits a pulse on a rising edge, i.e. when false changes to true. Does not pulse on program start even if initial input value is true.

attachments.content:
IN	OUT
true	no-pulse	// do not pulse even if initial state is true
false	no-pulse
true	pulse
true	no-pulse
false	no-pulse
true	pulse

@/pulse-on-change(string).description: Emits a pulse every time input value changes.

attachments.content:
IN	OUT
"initial string"	no-pulse
"hello there"	pulse
"hello there"	no-pulse
"a"	pulse
"aa"	pulse
"aaaaaaa"	pulse
"aaaaaaa"	no-pulse

HJo1OOdyG.description: Resets the current `Fx` and `N` to zero.
HJo1OOdyG.label: RST

HyzedOdkG.description: Triggers the generator update. It will update the output values.
HyzedOdkG.label: UPD

S1SWOd_1z.description: The signal value in [0, 1] range. Starts from 0.
S1SWOd_1z.label: OUT

SkvhPuO1M.description: An interval between sawtooth peaks, i.e. the period of the signal
SkvhPuO1M.label: T

SyapDuu1G.description: Enabled or not. If set to `false` pulses on `UPD` do not change the output value. Effectively that means the generator is paused. Set to `true` again to continue generation.
SyapDuu1G.label: EN

rypbuud1M.description: The number of current cycle.  Starts from 0.
rypbuud1M.label: N

@/select.description: Outputs `X𝑛` value based on which `S𝑛` pulse came last. By default outputs the value of the latest `X𝑛` input.

B1a7B_O1z.description: The number of a function cycle. Starts from 0.
B1a7B_O1z.label: N

Bk2ZBdOyf.description: An iterval between sawtooth peaks, i.e. the period of the function
Bk2ZBdOyf.label: T

HybQBdOyf.description: The function value in [0, 1] range. Starts from 0.
HybQBdOyf.label: OUT

SJqlS__yz.description: An input time value, i.e. the abscissa
SJqlS__yz.label: IN

BJB_WYnYyM.description: The signal value in [0, 1] range. Starts from 0.
BJB_WYnYyM.label: OUT

HyMdZFnYkf.description: An interval between wave peaks, i.e. the period of the signal
HyMdZFnYkf.label: T

SJIObF3YJz.description: The number of current cycle.  Starts from 0.
SJIObF3YJz.label: N

SJbuWY3FkG.description: Enabled or not. If set to `false` pulses on `UPD` do not change the output value. Effectively that means the generator is paused. Set to `true` again to continue generation.
SJbuWY3FkG.label: EN

Sy_ZYhFkM.description: Triggers the generator update. It will update the output values.
Sy_ZYhFkM.label: UPD

rkVuWYnF1M.description: Resets the current `OUT` and `N` to zero.
rkVuWYnF1M.label: RST

@/spread-error.description: If at least one of the inputs has an error the node raises an error on all outputs. If there are no errors the node passes input values through without changes.

BkeKyP66E.description: Default value that is emitted if IN did not match any Xns
BkeKyP66E.label: DEF

@/switch-case.description: Outputs Yn value when the corresponding Xn equals IN. If IN is not found among Xns, outputs DEF.

BkEVI0uHwJb.description: The last time read in seconds
BkEVI0uHwJb.label: TIME

@/system-time.description: Outputs time spent since the program start

attachments.content:
__time(ms)	UPD	TIME
0	pulse	0
100	pulse	0.1
1000	pulse	1
3000	pulse	3
600	pulse	0.6
1000	no-pulse	0.6
1000	pulse	1

BJNZzE3YJG.description: An input time value, i.e. the abscissa
BJNZzE3YJG.label: IN

BJUWz4nt1G.description: An iterval between wave peaks, i.e. the period of the function
BJUWz4nt1G.label: T

H1z-fVnFyz.description: The number of a function cycle. Starts from 0.
H1z-fVnFyz.label: N

r1e-zV2Fyz.description: The function value in [0, 1] range. Starts from 0.
r1e-zV2Fyz.label: OUT

@/sine-wave-map.description: Computes sine wave function value. It’s a periodical function with range [0, 1] which starts from 0.

BJ5HJ6t1f.description: Time interval between switches to `true`, i.e. the period of the square wave.
BJ5HJ6t1f.label: T

ByEPkpYkM.description: Enabled or not. When set to `false` pauses generation preserving the current phase. When set to `true` again continues counting from the saved phase.
ByEPkpYkM.label: EN

S1aYu6KJf.description: The signal value: `true` or `false`. When the phase is at switch boundary, the value is the same as `EN`, i.e. `false` if paused and `true` if active.
S1aYu6KJf.label: OUT

S1dK16FJf.description: The number of current cycle.  Starts from 0. The cycle is considered to start with the `true` value.
S1dK16FJf.label: N

rJS8ypK1z.description: Duty cycle. Ratio of `true` signal duration to the whole `IVAL`.
rJS8ypK1z.label: DUTY

ryQdyTYkz.description: Resets the wave phase and `N` to zero.
ryQdyTYkz.label: RST

@/to-percent.description: Transforms a number to percent string. For example, 0.42 to “42%”

Hy-vqRtJG.description: Duty cycle of ON time in range [0, 1]
Hy-vqRtJG.label: DUTY

@/time-to-duty.description: Converts two absolute time values representing on and off time to a total duration and duty cycle values

ByYWULHUr.description: IN will propagate to OUT at most once per T seconds
ByYWULHUr.label: T

H1H-LLHUr.description: The throttled output. Follows IN immediately if T time window has passed since the last update, otherwise conducts IN with a lag so that the time span between updates is no less than T

@/throttle.description: Throttles input changes to happen no more often than once per interval specified. Useful to limit the rate of updates.

BJMlTDdJM.description: The current time value in seconds.

HJF16v_kz.description: Resets the current time value to zero.
HJF16v_kz.label: RST

r1W1Tw_yz.description: Enabled or not. If set to `false` pulses on `UPD` do not change the output value. Effectively that means the timer is paused. Set to `true` again to continue time counting.
r1W1Tw_yz.label: EN

Bke855F1z.description: Triggers the generator update. It will update the output values.
Bke855F1z.label: UPD

HJ4Sc5FJG.description: Enabled or not. If set to `false` pulses on `UPD` do not change the output value. Effectively that means the generator is paused. Set to `true` again to continue generation.
HJ4Sc5FJG.label: EN

HJU8B5tkM.description: An interval between wave peaks, i.e. the period of the signal
HJU8B5tkM.label: T

S1iB5qFkz.description: Resets the current `Fx` and `N` to zero.
S1iB5qFkz.label: RST

SyFLcqtJG.description: The signal value in [0, 1] range. Starts from 0.
SyFLcqtJG.label: OUT

rykP99t1z.description: The number of current cycle.  Starts from 0.
rykP99t1z.label: N

BkK3N5Y1M.description: The function value in [0, 1] range. Starts from 0.
BkK3N5Y1M.label: OUT

HyiTVcFJG.description: The number of a function cycle. Starts from 0.
HyiTVcFJG.label: N

S1i0E5KkM.description: An input time value, i.e. the abscissa
S1i0E5KkM.label: IN

Sy7eS5tyz.description: An iterval between wave peaks, i.e. the period of the function
Sy7eS5tyz.label: T

SkpNbqx7r.description: Reset received pulses and make possible to fire the pulse again
SkpNbqx7r.label: RST

@/wait-all-once.description: Passes pulse only once when all `IN` pins received a pulse.

@/wait-all.description: Passes pulses through only when all `IN` pins received a pulse.

rySsCNowW.description: The result number. Equals to `HI` shifted left on 8 bits bitwise or’ed with `LO`.

@/word-to-number.description: Packs two bytes into an integer number

@/xor.description: Outputs true if and only if just one of inputs has true value

@/watch.description: Shows incoming values in the realtime, when a debug session is active

description: The very basic nodes of XOD
name: core
